page.title: 02ST.AGNES COASTGUARD LOOKOUT
page.content: ST.AGNES COASTGUARD STATION WAS BUILT IN 1930.EVEN THOUGH IT IS 55 YEARS OLD IT IS STILL IN GOOD CONDITION.AND IN WORKING ORDER .YOU CAN SEE TEN MILES IN FRONT OF YOU.YOU CAN SEE FROM GODREVY TO TREVOSE HEAD WHICH IS A RANGE OF 50 MILES.THE COASTGUARD STATION CATCHES THE WIND A LOT COMING FROM THE SOUTH.THE PEOPLE AT THE COASTGUARD LOOKOUT ARE ALL VOLUNTEERS.THERE IS USUALLY ONE PERSON ON COASTGUARD DUTY DAY AND NIGHT IN THE SUMMER.IF THERE IS A RESCUE ABOUT 9 MEN COME TO HELP. THE LOOKOUT IS IN TOUCH WITH THE MAIN COASTGUARD STATION AT ST.AGNES BY A BLEEPER SYSTEM, THE TELEPHONE AND VHF RADIO.
